data.title: Trumbull, Jonathan, 1710-1785
data.text:
Scope and Contents:

Fragment of a list, written in manuscript and signed "Jonth. Trumble, Colonel of the 12th Regiment," at Lebanon, Connecticut.

The fragment includes names of soldiers and towns, with dates, apparently of enlistment and muster.

Accompanied by a photocopy of a "Billeting Bill," dated 1757, for a company under command of Captain Edward Wells, including some of the same soldiers' names.

Scope and Contents:

ALS to Barnabas Deane, Dec 25, 1776, regarding cannon for Commodore Manly's ship "Hancock"; order, copied in autograph manuscript in an unidentified hand, to Colonel John Douglas, Dec 3, 1776, regarding mustering of his regiment, with appended order from Douglas to Captain Joseph Palmer, regarding mustering of his company, Dec 5, 1776; and fragment of an autograph manuscript order, signed, to Brigadier General John Douglas, Jul 9, 1779.

Abstract:

Contains legal documents signed by Jonathan Trumbull (1710-1785) while governor, and one letter from him to Jonathan Trumbull (1740-1809); a letter from George Washington to Jonathan Trumbull (1740-1809); letters between John Trumbull and various people, regarding his paintings and exhibitions; receipts relating to his work; and draft and printed versions of the handbill announcing the print of his "The Declaration of Independence."

Abstract:

The papers consist of correspondence, legal and financial records, and writings which document the artistic career, business ventures, and personal life of John Trumbull. The papers also include correspondence, diaries, and financial and legal records of other Trumbull family members and of related Huntington, Lanman, Silliman, and Wadsworth family members. Files of Theodore Sizer containing his research material and writings on John Trumbull are also in the papers.
